*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Warren Buford [May —, 1825?]. Summary of the colonization law and other terms of settlement.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[May—, 1825?]*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr. Warren Buford*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*You state that a number of your *person_mentioned*neighbors */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*from the *person_mentioned*Attackapas */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Oppelusas */person_mentioned*wish to remove to this *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*and have requested of me to inform you on what terms they can be recd the quantity of land that will be allowed them etc in answer to which enquiry I have to inform you*/p*
*p*1—I am authorised by the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*as a*person_mentioned* Contractor (Empresario)*/person_mentioned* to introduce and settle *person_mentioned*five hundred families */person_mentioned**location_mentioned*on the waters of the Brazos and Colorado rivers*/location_mentioned* including also *location_mentioned*the East side of La Baca and the West side of San Jacinto from the upper or San Antonio road to within ten Leagues of the Sea Coast,*/location_mentioned* no new *location_mentioned*grants*/location_mentioned* of *location_mentioned*upland */location_mentioned*can be made nearer than that distance from the *location_mentioned*Coast*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*2—The 5th Article of the law of Colonization declares that all *person_mentioned*new settlers*/person_mentioned* shall prove their Christianity morality and general characters by certificates from the *person_mentioned*authorities of the place where they moved from*/person_mentioned*. If these certificates are satisfactory they will be recd and if not they will be rejected, for the law, contemplates and the instructions of the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*strictly enjoin that none but *person_mentioned*men of integrity*/person_mentioned*, Sobriety and industry should be permitted to settle in the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*— *person_mentioned*Criminals*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*fugitives */person_mentioned*from justice and *person_mentioned*notorious vagabonds*/person_mentioned* proven to be such are ordered to be driven from the *location_mentioned*State */location_mentioned*by *person_mentioned*military force*/person_mentioned* or otherwise punis[hed] for having imposed or attempted to impose them[selves] on the Govt, for *person_mentioned*honest and industrious men*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*2—The 11th article of the same law says that " a Square of land which measures one League or five thousand varas (Mexican yards) on each side, or what is the same thing a Superficie of 25,000,000 Square varas shall be called a *location_mentioned*Sitio*/location_mentioned* and this shall be the unit for counting one two or more Sitios, and the unity for counting one two or more *location_mentioned*labors*/location_mentioned* shall be a Superficie of one million Square varas, or one thousand varas on each side which shall compose a labor of land*/p*
*p*3—The 14 article of the same law says that " to each *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*whose " only occupation is cultivating the earth (labrar la tierra) there " shall be granted one *location_mentioned*labor*/location_mentioned*, if he is also a *person_mentioned*Stock raiser*/person_mentioned* there may be " added one *location_mentioned*Sitio*/location_mentioned* of land proper for raising stock, and if he is only " a *person_mentioned*Stock raiser*/person_mentioned* he can only have a Superficie of Said Stock land of " 24,000,000 square varas*/p*
*p*4—The 15 Article provides that *person_mentioned*Single men*/person_mentioned* shall only receive the fourth part of what is allowed by the 14 article for *person_mentioned*married men*/person_mentioned*—*/p*
*p*5—The 17 article provides that on the recommendation of the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*can augment the quantity of land above designated in proportion to the size of the *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*, capital and enterprise of the *person_mentioned*Settler*/person_mentioned*, but in no instance to exceed Eleven leagues.*/p*
*p*6—The said law also says that the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*appointed by the *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*, shall employ *person_mentioned*Surveyors */person_mentioned*and lay of the land for such *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*as are recd by the *person_mentioned*Contractor (Empresario)*/person_mentioned* and returned to him as *person_mentioned*settlers*/person_mentioned*, and that he shall issue to each one of them a complete title for his land in the name of the *person_mentioned*Government*/person_mentioned*—The expences of Surveying—the *person_mentioned*Commissioners */person_mentioned*and other office fees and thirty dollars on each league to the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*must be paid by the *person_mentioned*settler*/person_mentioned*— the 30 Dollars pr. league to the *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*, is to be paid in three instalments the first four years the 2d. five years and the 3d. 6 years after the date of the *location_mentioned*Grant*/location_mentioned*, the amount of the Surveying fees will depend on the contracts made by the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*with the *person_mentioned*Surveyors*/person_mentioned*— heretofore a fraction more than three dollars pr. english mile has been given, these fees must be paid when the title is recd as the *person_mentioned*Commissioner */person_mentioned*has not yet arrived I cannot state what his fees or the other expences will be, tho I will insure that all the expences including *person_mentioned*Government*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Commissioners*/person_mentioned*, and all other fees and surveying will not exceed 12 1/2 cents pr. *location_mentioned*english acre*/location_mentioned* if so much and but a small part of that will be required down I have hereto fore never rejected any man as a *person_mentioned*settler */person_mentioned*because he had not the means of paying the expences on his land in such cases I have on my own responsability allowed time for the *person_mentioned*settler */person_mentioned*to make his payments even the surveying fees— in many instances of this nature I have been deceived and suffered a total loss, this will compel me to be more particular in future, tho as a genl, rule no *person_mentioned*settler */person_mentioned*who has a *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*and satisfactorily proves his integrity Sobriety and industry and who has been reduced by misfortunes, will be rejected by me no matter how poor he may be A *person_mentioned*settler */person_mentioned*on his arrival here presents himself to me with his credentials of character, if these are satisfactory a register is made of his name, where he moved from whether married or single— the number ages and sexes of his *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*: the oath prescribed by law is then administered to support the constitution and no one can get a title to land untill he has actually removed to the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*. Six years is allowed to improve and settle the land, and anyone who moves out of the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*forfeits his *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*unless he had sold it— and if he sells it without improving it as the law requires the sale is void and the land reverts to *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*, but every one who has improved his land can sell it and leave the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and the sale is good provided it is made before he moves away.*/p*
*p*[Stephen F. Austin.]*/p*
*/div1*
